member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AcknowledgeJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the AcknowledgeJob operation. Returns information about a specified job and whether that job has been received by the job worker. Used for custom actions only.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AcknowledgeJobRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique system-generated ID of the job for which you want to confirm receipt.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AcknowledgeJobRequest.Nonce
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Nonce.
A system-generated random number that AWS CodePipeline uses to ensure that the job is being worked on by only one job worker. Get this number from the response of the PollForJobs request that returned this job.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AcknowledgeJobResponse
member.summary: Represents the output of an AcknowledgeJob action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AcknowledgeJobResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Whether the job worker has received the specified job.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the AcknowledgeThirdPartyJob operation. Confirms a job worker has received the specified job. Used for partner actions only.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
The clientToken portion of the clientId and clientToken pair used to verify that the calling entity is allowed access to the job and its details.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique system-generated ID of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobRequest.Nonce
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Nonce.
A system-generated random number that AWS CodePipeline uses to ensure that the job is being worked on by only one job worker. Get this number from the response to a GetThirdPartyJobDetails request.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobResponse
member.summary: Represents the output of an AcknowledgeThirdPartyJob action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AcknowledgeThirdPartyJobResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status information for the third party job, if any.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionConfiguration
member.summary: Represents information about an action configuration.

Gets and sets the property Configuration.
The configuration data for the action.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionConfigurationProperty
member.summary: Represents information about an action configuration property.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionConfigurationProperty.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description of the action configuration property that is displayed to users.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionConfigurationProperty.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
Whether the configuration property is a key.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionConfigurationProperty.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the action configuration property.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionConfigurationProperty.Queryable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Queryable.
Indicates that the property is used with PollForJobs. When creating a custom action, an action can have up to one queryable property. If it has one, that property must be both required and not secret.
If you create a pipeline with a custom action type, and that custom action contains a queryable property, the value for that configuration property is subject to other restrictions. The value must be less than or equal to twenty (20) characters. The value can contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionConfigurationProperty.Required
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Required.
Whether the configuration property is a required value.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionConfigurationProperty.Secret
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Secret.
Whether the configuration property is secret. Secrets are hidden from all calls except for GetJobDetails, GetThirdPartyJobDetails, PollForJobs, and PollForThirdPartyJobs.
When updating a pipeline, passing * * * * * without changing any other values of the action preserves the previous value of the secret.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionConfigurationProperty.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of the configuration property.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionContext
member.summary: Represents the context of an action in the stage of a pipeline to a job worker.

member.summary:

The system-generated unique ID that corresponds to an action's execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionContext.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the action in the context of a job.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionDeclaration
member.summary: Represents information about an action declaration.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionDeclaration.ActionTypeId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionTypeId.
Specifies the action type and the provider of the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionDeclaration.Configuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Configuration.
The action's configuration. These are key-value pairs that specify input values for an action. For more information, see Action Structure Requirements in CodePipeline. For the list of configuration properties for the AWS CloudFormation action type in CodePipeline, see Configuration Properties Reference in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide. For template snippets with examples, see Using Parameter Override Functions with CodePipeline Pipelines in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.
The values can be represented in either JSON or YAML format. For example, the JSON configuration item format is as follows:
JSON:
"Configuration" : { Key : Value },

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionDeclaration.InputArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputArtifacts.
The name or ID of the artifact consumed by the action, such as a test or build artifact.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionDeclaration.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The action declaration's name.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionDeclaration.Namespace
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Namespace.
The variable namespace associated with the action. All variables produced as output by this action fall under this namespace.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionDeclaration.OutputArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputArtifacts.
The name or ID of the result of the action declaration, such as a test or build artifact.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionDeclaration.Region
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Region.
The action declaration's AWS Region, such as us-east-1.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionDeclaration.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The ARN of the IAM service role that performs the declared action. This is assumed through the roleArn for the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionDeclaration.RunOrder
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RunOrder.
The order in which actions are run.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionExecution
member.summary: Represents information about the run of an action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionExecution.ActionExecutionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionExecutionId.
ID of the workflow action execution in the current stage. Use the GetPipelineState action to retrieve the current action execution details of the current stage.
For older executions, this field might be empty. The action execution ID is available for executions run on or after March 2020.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionExecution.ErrorDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorDetails.
The details of an error returned by a URL external to AWS.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionExecution.ExternalExecutionId
member.summary:

The external ID of the run of the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionExecution.ExternalExecutionUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExternalExecutionUrl.
The URL of a resource external to AWS that is used when running the action (for example, an external repository URL).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionExecution.LastStatusChange
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastStatusChange.
The last status change of the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionExecution.LastUpdatedBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastUpdatedBy.
The ARN of the user who last changed the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionExecution.PercentComplete
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PercentComplete.
A percentage of completeness of the action as it runs.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionExecution.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the action, or for a completed action, the last status of the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionExecution.Summary
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Summary.
A summary of the run of the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionExecution.Token
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Token.
The system-generated token used to identify a unique approval request. The token for each open approval request can be obtained using the GetPipelineState command. It is used to validate that the approval request corresponding to this token is still valid.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeExecutor
member.summary: The action engine, or executor, for an action type created for a provider, where the action is to be used by customers of the provider. The action engine is associated with the model used to create and update the action, such as the Lambda integration model.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeExecutor.Configuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Configuration.
The action configuration properties for the action type. These properties are specified in the action definition when the action type is created.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeExecutor.JobTimeout
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobTimeout.
The timeout in seconds for the job. An action execution can have multiple jobs. This is the timeout for a single job, not the entire action execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeExecutor.PolicyStatementsTemplate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyStatementsTemplate.
The policy statement that specifies the permissions in the CodePipeline customer’s account that are needed to successfully run an action.
To grant permission to another account, specify the account ID as the Principal, a domain-style identifier defined by the service, for example codepipeline.amazonaws.com.
The size of the passed JSON policy document cannot exceed 2048 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeExecutor.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The integration model used to create and update the action type, Lambda or JobWorker.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeId
member.summary: Represents information about an action type.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeId.Category
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Category.
A category defines what kind of action can be taken in the stage, and constrains the provider type for the action. Valid categories are limited to one of the following values.
Source
Build
Test
Deploy
Invoke
Approval

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeId.Owner
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Owner.
The creator of the action being called. There are three valid values for the Owner field in the action category section within your pipeline structure: AWS, ThirdParty, and Custom. For more information, see Valid Action Types and Providers in CodePipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeId.Provider
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Provider.
The provider of the service being called by the action. Valid providers are determined by the action category. For example, an action in the Deploy category type might have a provider of AWS CodeDeploy, which would be specified as CodeDeploy. For more information, see Valid Action Types and Providers in CodePipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeId.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
A string that describes the action version.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeIdentifier

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeIdentifier.Category
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Category.
Defines what kind of action can be taken in the stage, one of the following:
Source
Build
Test
Deploy
Approval
Invoke

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeIdentifier.Owner
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Owner.
The creator of the action type being called: AWS or ThirdParty.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeIdentifier.Provider
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Provider.
The provider of the action type being called. The provider name is supplied when the action type is created.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeIdentifier.Version
member.summary:

A string that describes the action type version.

member.summary:

Whether to omit the field value entered by the customer in the log. If true, the value is not saved in CloudTrail logs for the action execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeProperty.Optional
member.summary:

Whether the configuration property is an optional value.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeProperty.Queryable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Queryable.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeSettings
member.summary: Returns information about the settings for an action type.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeSettings.EntityUrlTemplate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EntityUrlTemplate.
The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that provides a deep link to the resources of the external system, such as the configuration page for an AWS CodeDeploy deployment group. This link is provided as part of the action display in the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeSettings.ExecutionUrlTemplate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionUrlTemplate.
The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that contains a link to the top-level landing page for the external system, such as the console page for AWS CodeDeploy. This link is shown on the pipeline view page in the AWS CodePipeline console and provides a link to the execution entity of the external action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeSettings.RevisionUrlTemplate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RevisionUrlTemplate.
The URL returned to the AWS CodePipeline console that contains a link to the page where customers can update or change the configuration of the external action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeSettings.ThirdPartyConfigurationUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ThirdPartyConfigurationUrl.
The URL of a sign-up page where users can sign up for an external service and perform initial configuration of the action provided by that service.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeUrls.ConfigurationUrl
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeUrls.EntityUrlTemplate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EntityUrlTemplate.
The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that provides a deep link to the resources of the external system, such as a status page. This link is provided as part of the action display in the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ActionTypeUrls.ExecutionUrlTemplate
member.summary:

member.summary:

The date and time when the most recent revision of the artifact was created, in timestamp format.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of an artifact. This name might be system-generated, such as "MyApp", or defined by the user when an action is created.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ArtifactRevision.RevisionChangeIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RevisionChangeIdentifier.
An additional identifier for a revision, such as a commit date or, for artifacts stored in Amazon S3 buckets, the ETag value.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ArtifactRevision.RevisionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RevisionId.
The revision ID of the artifact.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ArtifactRevision.RevisionSummary
member.summary:

Summary information about the most recent revision of the artifact. For GitHub and AWS CodeCommit repositories, the commit message. For Amazon S3 buckets or actions, the user-provided content of a codepipeline-artifact-revision-summary key specified in the object metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ArtifactRevision.RevisionUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RevisionUrl.
The commit ID for the artifact revision. For artifacts stored in GitHub or AWS CodeCommit repositories, the commit ID is linked to a commit details page.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ArtifactStore
member.summary:
The S3 bucket where artifacts for the pipeline are stored.
You must include either artifactStore or artifactStores in your pipeline, but you cannot use both. If you create a cross-region action in your pipeline, you must use artifactStores.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ArtifactStore.EncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKey.
The encryption key used to encrypt the data in the artifact store, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key. If this is undefined, the default key for Amazon S3 is used.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ArtifactStore.Location
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Location.
The S3 bucket used for storing the artifacts for a pipeline. You can specify the name of an S3 bucket but not a folder in the bucket. A folder to contain the pipeline artifacts is created for you based on the name of the pipeline. You can use any S3 bucket in the same AWS Region as the pipeline to store your pipeline artifacts.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ArtifactStore.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of the artifact store, such as S3.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AWSSessionCredentials

The secret access key for the session.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.AWSSessionCredentials.SessionToken
member.summary:

Gets and sets the property Category.
The category of the custom action, such as a build action or a test action.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationProperties.
The configuration properties for the custom action.
You can refer to a name in the configuration properties of the custom action within the URL templates by following the format of {Config:name}, as long as the configuration property is both required and not secret. For more information, see Create a Custom Action for a Pipeline.

member.summary:

The provider of the service used in the custom action, such as AWS CodeDeploy.

member.summary:

URLs that provide users information about this custom action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.CreateCustomActionTypeRequest.Tags
member.summary:

Container for the parameters to the CreatePipeline operation. Creates a pipeline.
In the pipeline structure, you must include either artifactStore or artifactStores in your pipeline, but you cannot use both. If you create a cross-region action in your pipeline, you must use artifactStores.

member.summary:

Represents the structure of actions and stages to be performed in the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.CreatePipelineResponse.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies the tags applied to the pipeline.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeleteCustomActionTypeRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteCustomActionType operation. Marks a custom action as deleted. PollForJobs for the custom action fails after the action is marked for deletion. Used for custom actions only.
To re-create a custom action after it has been deleted you must use a string in the version field that has never been used before. This string can be an incremented version number, for example. To restore a deleted custom action, use a JSON file that is identical to the deleted action, including the original string in the version field.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeleteCustomActionTypeRequest.Category
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Category.
The category of the custom action that you want to delete, such as source or deploy.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeleteCustomActionTypeRequest.Provider
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Provider.
The provider of the service used in the custom action, such as AWS CodeDeploy.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeleteCustomActionTypeRequest.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The version of the custom action to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeleteCustomActionTypeResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteCustomActionType operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeletePipelineRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeletePipeline operation. Deletes the specified pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeletePipelineRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the pipeline to be deleted.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeletePipelineResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeletePipeline operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeleteWebhookRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteWebhook operation. Deletes a previously created webhook by name. Deleting the webhook stops AWS CodePipeline from starting a pipeline every time an external event occurs. The API returns successfully when trying to delete a webhook that is already deleted. If a deleted webhook is re-created by calling PutWebhook with the same name, it will have a different URL.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeleteWebhookRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the webhook you want to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeleteWebhookResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteWebhook operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeregisterWebhookWithThirdPartyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeregisterWebhookWithThirdParty operation. Removes the connection between the webhook that was created by CodePipeline and the external tool with events to be detected. Currently supported only for webhooks that target an action type of GitHub.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeregisterWebhookWithThirdPartyRequest.WebhookName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WebhookName.
The name of the webhook you want to deregister.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DeregisterWebhookWithThirdPartyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeregisterWebhookWithThirdParty operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DisableStageTransitionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DisableStageTransition operation. Prevents artifacts in a pipeline from transitioning to the next stage in the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DisableStageTransitionRequest.PipelineName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineName.
The name of the pipeline in which you want to disable the flow of artifacts from one stage to another.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DisableStageTransitionRequest.Reason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Reason.
The reason given to the user that a stage is disabled, such as waiting for manual approval or manual tests. This message is displayed in the pipeline console UI.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DisableStageTransitionRequest.StageName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StageName.
The name of the stage where you want to disable the inbound or outbound transition of artifacts.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DisableStageTransitionRequest.TransitionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TransitionType.
Specifies whether artifacts are prevented from transitioning into the stage and being processed by the actions in that stage (inbound), or prevented from transitioning from the stage after they have been processed by the actions in that stage (outbound).

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.DisableStageTransitionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DisableStageTransition operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.EnableStageTransitionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the EnableStageTransition operation. Enables artifacts in a pipeline to transition to a stage in a pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.EnableStageTransitionRequest.PipelineName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineName.
The name of the pipeline in which you want to enable the flow of artifacts from one stage to another.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.EnableStageTransitionRequest.StageName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StageName.
The name of the stage where you want to enable the transition of artifacts, either into the stage (inbound) or from that stage to the next stage (outbound).

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.EnableStageTransitionRequest.TransitionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TransitionType.
Specifies whether artifacts are allowed to enter the stage and be processed by the actions in that stage (inbound) or whether already processed artifacts are allowed to transition to the next stage (outbound).

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.EnableStageTransitionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the EnableStageTransition operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.EncryptionKey
member.summary: Represents information about the key used to encrypt data in the artifact store, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.EncryptionKey.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The ID used to identify the key. For an AWS KMS key, you can use the key ID, the key ARN, or the alias ARN.
Aliases are recognized only in the account that created the customer master key (CMK). For cross-account actions, you can only use the key ID or key ARN to identify the key.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.EncryptionKey.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of encryption key, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key. When creating or updating a pipeline, the value must be set to 'KMS'.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ErrorDetails
member.summary: Represents information about an error in AWS CodePipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ErrorDetails.Code
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Code.
The system ID or number code of the error.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ErrorDetails.Message
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Message.
The text of the error message.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ExecutionDetails
member.summary: The details of the actions taken and results produced on an artifact as it passes through stages in the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ExecutionDetails.ExternalExecutionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExternalExecutionId.
The system-generated unique ID of this action used to identify this job worker in any external systems, such as AWS CodeDeploy.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ExecutionDetails.PercentComplete
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PercentComplete.
The percentage of work completed on the action, represented on a scale of 0 to 100 percent.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ExecutionDetails.Summary
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Summary.
The summary of the current status of the actions.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ExecutionTrigger
member.summary: The interaction or event that started a pipeline execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ExecutionTrigger.TriggerDetail
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TriggerDetail.
Detail related to the event that started a pipeline execution, such as the webhook ARN of the webhook that triggered the pipeline execution or the user ARN for a user-initiated start-pipeline-execution CLI command.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ExecutionTrigger.TriggerType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TriggerType.
The type of change-detection method, command, or user interaction that started a pipeline execution.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ExecutorConfiguration
member.summary: The action engine, or executor, related to the supported integration model used to create and update the action type. The available executor types are Lambda and JobWorker.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ExecutorConfiguration.JobWorkerExecutorConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobWorkerExecutorConfiguration.
Details about the JobWorker executor of the action type.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ExecutorConfiguration.LambdaExecutorConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LambdaExecutorConfiguration.
Details about the Lambda executor of the action type.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.FailureDetails
member.summary: Represents information about failure details.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.FailureDetails.ExternalExecutionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExternalExecutionId.
The external ID of the run of the action that failed.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.FailureDetails.Message
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Message.
The message about the failure.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.FailureDetails.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of the failure.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetActionTypeRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetActionType operation. Returns information about an action type created for an external provider, where the action is to be used by customers of the external provider. The action can be created with any supported integration model.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetActionTypeRequest.Category
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Category.
Defines what kind of action can be taken in the stage. The following are the valid values:
Source
Build
Test
Deploy
Approval
Invoke

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetActionTypeRequest.Owner
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Owner.
The creator of an action type that was created with any supported integration model. There are two valid values: AWS and ThirdParty.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetActionTypeRequest.Provider
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Provider.
The provider of the action type being called. The provider name is specified when the action type is created.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetActionTypeRequest.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
A string that describes the action type version.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetActionTypeResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetActionType operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetActionTypeResponse.ActionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionType.
The action type information for the requested action type, such as the action type ID.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetJobDetailsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetJobDetails operation. Returns information about a job. Used for custom actions only.
When this API is called, AWS CodePipeline returns temporary credentials for the S3 bucket used to store artifacts for the pipeline, if the action requires access to that S3 bucket for input or output artifacts. This API also returns any secret values defined for the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetJobDetailsRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique system-generated ID for the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetJobDetailsResponse
member.summary: Represents the output of a GetJobDetails action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetJobDetailsResponse.JobDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobDetails.
The details of the job.
If AWSSessionCredentials is used, a long-running job can call GetJobDetails again to obtain new credentials.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineExecutionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetPipelineExecution operation. Returns information about an execution of a pipeline, including details about artifacts, the pipeline execution ID, and the name, version, and status of the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineExecutionRequest.PipelineExecutionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineExecutionId.
The ID of the pipeline execution about which you want to get execution details.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineExecutionRequest.PipelineName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineName.
The name of the pipeline about which you want to get execution details.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineExecutionResponse
member.summary: Represents the output of a GetPipelineExecution action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineExecutionResponse.PipelineExecution
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineExecution.
Represents information about the execution of a pipeline.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetPipeline operation. Returns the metadata, structure, stages, and actions of a pipeline. Can be used to return the entire structure of a pipeline in JSON format, which can then be modified and used to update the pipeline structure with UpdatePipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the pipeline for which you want to get information. Pipeline names must be unique under an AWS user account.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineRequest.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The version number of the pipeline. If you do not specify a version, defaults to the current version.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineResponse
member.summary: Represents the output of a GetPipeline action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineResponse.Metadata
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metadata.
Represents the pipeline metadata information returned as part of the output of a GetPipeline action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineResponse.Pipeline
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Pipeline.
Represents the structure of actions and stages to be performed in the pipeline.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineStateRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetPipelineState operation. Returns information about the state of a pipeline, including the stages and actions.
Values returned in the revisionId and revisionUrl fields indicate the source revision information, such as the commit ID, for the current state.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineStateRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the pipeline about which you want to get information.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineStateResponse
member.summary: Represents the output of a GetPipelineState action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineStateResponse.Created
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Created.
The date and time the pipeline was created, in timestamp format.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineStateResponse.PipelineName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineName.
The name of the pipeline for which you want to get the state.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineStateResponse.PipelineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineVersion.
The version number of the pipeline.
A newly created pipeline is always assigned a version number of 1.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineStateResponse.StageStates
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StageStates.
A list of the pipeline stage output information, including stage name, state, most recent run details, whether the stage is disabled, and other data.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetPipelineStateResponse.Updated
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Updated.
The date and time the pipeline was last updated, in timestamp format.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetThirdPartyJobDetailsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetThirdPartyJobDetails operation. Requests the details of a job for a third party action. Used for partner actions only.
When this API is called, AWS CodePipeline returns temporary credentials for the S3 bucket used to store artifacts for the pipeline, if the action requires access to that S3 bucket for input or output artifacts. This API also returns any secret values defined for the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetThirdPartyJobDetailsRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
The clientToken portion of the clientId and clientToken pair used to verify that the calling entity is allowed access to the job and its details.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetThirdPartyJobDetailsRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique system-generated ID used for identifying the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetThirdPartyJobDetailsResponse
member.summary: Represents the output of a GetThirdPartyJobDetails action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.GetThirdPartyJobDetailsResponse.JobDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobDetails.
The details of the job, including any protected values defined for the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.InputArtifact
member.summary: Represents information about an artifact to be worked on, such as a test or build artifact.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.InputArtifact.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the artifact to be worked on (for example, "My App").
The input artifact of an action must exactly match the output artifact declared in a preceding action, but the input artifact does not have to be the next action in strict sequence from the action that provided the output artifact. Actions in parallel can declare different output artifacts, which are in turn consumed by different following actions.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.Job
member.summary: Represents information about a job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.Job.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The ID of the AWS account to use when performing the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.Job.Data
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
Other data about a job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.Job.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique system-generated ID of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.Job.Nonce
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Nonce.
A system-generated random number that AWS CodePipeline uses to ensure that the job is being worked on by only one job worker. Use this number in an AcknowledgeJob request.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobData
member.summary: Represents other information about a job required for a job worker to complete the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobData.ActionConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionConfiguration.
Represents information about an action configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobData.ActionTypeId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionTypeId.
Represents information about an action type.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobData.ArtifactCredentials
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ArtifactCredentials.
Represents an AWS session credentials object. These credentials are temporary credentials that are issued by AWS Secure Token Service (STS). They can be used to access input and output artifacts in the S3 bucket used to store artifacts for the pipeline in AWS CodePipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobData.ContinuationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContinuationToken.
A system-generated token, such as a AWS CodeDeploy deployment ID, required by a job to continue the job asynchronously.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobData.EncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKey.
Represents information about the key used to encrypt data in the artifact store, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobData.InputArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputArtifacts.
The artifact supplied to the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobData.OutputArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputArtifacts.
The output of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobData.PipelineContext
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineContext.
Represents information about a pipeline to a job worker.
Includes pipelineArn and pipelineExecutionId for custom jobs.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobDetails
member.summary: Represents information about the details of a job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobDetails.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The AWS account ID associated with the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobDetails.Data
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
Represents other information about a job required for a job worker to complete the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.JobDetails.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique system-generated ID of the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ListActionExecutionsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListActionExecutions operation. Lists the action executions that have occurred in a pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ListActionExecutionsRequest.Filter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filter.
Input information used to filter action execution history.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ListActionExecutionsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results to return in a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value. Action execution history is retained for up to 12 months, based on action execution start times. Default value is 100.
Detailed execution history is available for executions run on or after February 21, 2019.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ListActionExecutionsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token that was returned from the previous ListActionExecutions call, which can be used to return the next set of action executions in the list.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ListActionExecutionsRequest.PipelineName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineName.
The name of the pipeline for which you want to list action execution history.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.OutputArtifact.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the output of an artifact, such as "My App".
The input artifact of an action must exactly match the output artifact declared in a preceding action, but the input artifact does not have to be the next action in strict sequence from the action that provided the output artifact. Actions in parallel can declare different output artifacts, which are in turn consumed by different following actions.
Output artifact names must be unique within a pipeline.

Represents information about a pipeline to a job worker.
PipelineContext contains pipelineArn and pipelineExecutionId for custom action jobs. The pipelineArn and pipelineExecutionId fields are not populated for ThirdParty action jobs.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The context of an action to a job worker in the stage of a pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineContext.PipelineArn
member.summary:

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineContext.PipelineExecutionId
member.summary:

The execution ID of the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineContext.PipelineName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineName.
The name of the pipeline. This is a user-specified value. Pipeline names must be unique across all pipeline names under an Amazon Web Services account.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineContext.Stage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Stage.
The stage of the pipeline.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineDeclaration
member.summary: Represents the structure of actions and stages to be performed in the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineDeclaration.ArtifactStore
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ArtifactStore.
Represents information about the S3 bucket where artifacts are stored for the pipeline.
You must include either artifactStore or artifactStores in your pipeline, but you cannot use both. If you create a cross-region action in your pipeline, you must use artifactStores.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineDeclaration.ArtifactStores
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ArtifactStores.
A mapping of artifactStore objects and their corresponding AWS Regions. There must be an artifact store for the pipeline Region and for each cross-region action in the pipeline.
You must include either artifactStore or artifactStores in your pipeline, but you cannot use both. If you create a cross-region action in your pipeline, you must use artifactStores.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineDeclaration.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineDeclaration.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for AWS CodePipeline to use to either perform actions with no actionRoleArn, or to use to assume roles for actions with an actionRoleArn.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineDeclaration.Stages
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Stages.
The stage in which to perform the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineDeclaration.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The version number of the pipeline. A new pipeline always has a version number of 1. This number is incremented when a pipeline is updated.

The ID of the pipeline execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineExecution.PipelineName
member.summary:

The name of the pipeline with the specified pipeline execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineExecution.PipelineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineVersion.
The version number of the pipeline with the specified pipeline execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineExecution.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the pipeline execution.
Cancelled: The pipeline’s definition was updated before the pipeline execution could be completed.
InProgress: The pipeline execution is currently running.
Stopped: The pipeline execution was manually stopped. For more information, see Stopped Executions.
Stopping: The pipeline execution received a request to be manually stopped. Depending on the selected stop mode, the execution is either completing or abandoning in-progress actions. For more information, see Stopped Executions.
Succeeded: The pipeline execution was completed successfully.
Superseded: While this pipeline execution was waiting for the next stage to be completed, a newer pipeline execution advanced and continued through the pipeline instead. For more information, see Superseded Executions.
Failed: The pipeline execution was not completed successfully.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PipelineExecution.StatusSummary
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusSummary.
A summary that contains a description of the pipeline execution status.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PollForJobsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PollForJobs operation. Returns information about any jobs for AWS CodePipeline to act on. PollForJobs is valid only for action types with "Custom" in the owner field. If the action type contains "AWS" or "ThirdParty" in the owner field, the PollForJobs action returns an error.
When this API is called, AWS CodePipeline returns temporary credentials for the S3 bucket used to store artifacts for the pipeline, if the action requires access to that S3 bucket for input or output artifacts. This API also returns any secret values defined for the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PollForJobsRequest.ActionTypeId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionTypeId.
Represents information about an action type.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PollForJobsRequest.MaxBatchSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxBatchSize.
The maximum number of jobs to return in a poll for jobs call.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PollForJobsRequest.QueryParam
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QueryParam.
A map of property names and values. For an action type with no queryable properties, this value must be null or an empty map. For an action type with a queryable property, you must supply that property as a key in the map. Only jobs whose action configuration matches the mapped value are returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PollForJobsResponse
member.summary: Represents the output of a PollForJobs action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PollForJobsResponse.Jobs
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Jobs.
Information about the jobs to take action on.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PollForThirdPartyJobsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PollForThirdPartyJobs operation. Determines whether there are any third party jobs for a job worker to act on. Used for partner actions only.
When this API is called, AWS CodePipeline returns temporary credentials for the S3 bucket used to store artifacts for the pipeline, if the action requires access to that S3 bucket for input or output artifacts.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PollForThirdPartyJobsRequest.ActionTypeId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionTypeId.
Represents information about an action type.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PollForThirdPartyJobsRequest.MaxBatchSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxBatchSize.
The maximum number of jobs to return in a poll for jobs call.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PollForThirdPartyJobsResponse
member.summary: Represents the output of a PollForThirdPartyJobs action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PollForThirdPartyJobsResponse.Jobs
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Jobs.
Information about the jobs to take action on.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutApprovalResultRequest.PipelineName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineName.
The name of the pipeline that contains the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutApprovalResultRequest.Result
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Result.
Represents information about the result of the approval request.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutApprovalResultRequest.StageName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StageName.
The name of the stage that contains the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutApprovalResultRequest.Token
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Token.
The system-generated token used to identify a unique approval request. The token for each open approval request can be obtained using the GetPipelineState action. It is used to validate that the approval request corresponding to this token is still valid.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutApprovalResultResponse
member.summary: Represents the output of a PutApprovalResult action.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutJobFailureResultRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutJobFailureResult operation. Represents the failure of a job as returned to the pipeline by a job worker. Used for custom actions only.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutJobFailureResultRequest.FailureDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailureDetails.
The details about the failure of a job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutJobFailureResultRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique system-generated ID of the job that failed. This is the same ID returned from PollForJobs.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutJobFailureResultResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutJobFailureResult operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutJobSuccessResultRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutJobSuccessResult operation. Represents the success of a job as returned to the pipeline by a job worker. Used for custom actions only.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutJobSuccessResultRequest.ContinuationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContinuationToken.
A token generated by a job worker, such as an AWS CodeDeploy deployment ID, that a successful job provides to identify a custom action in progress. Future jobs use this token to identify the running instance of the action. It can be reused to return more information about the progress of the custom action. When the action is complete, no continuation token should be supplied.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutJobSuccessResultRequest.CurrentRevision
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CurrentRevision.
The ID of the current revision of the artifact successfully worked on by the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutJobSuccessResultRequest.ExecutionDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExecutionDetails.
The execution details of the successful job, such as the actions taken by the job worker.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutJobSuccessResultRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique system-generated ID of the job that succeeded. This is the same ID returned from PollForJobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutJobSuccessResultRequest.OutputVariables
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputVariables.
Key-value pairs produced as output by a job worker that can be made available to a downstream action configuration. outputVariables can be included only when there is no continuation token on the request.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutJobSuccessResultResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutJobSuccessResult operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutThirdPartyJobFailureResultRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
The clientToken portion of the clientId and clientToken pair used to verify that the calling entity is allowed access to the job and its details.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutThirdPartyJobFailureResultRequest.FailureDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailureDetails.
Represents information about failure details.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The ID of the job that failed. This is the same ID returned from PollForThirdPartyJobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutThirdPartyJobSuccessResultRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
The clientToken portion of the clientId and clientToken pair used to verify that the calling entity is allowed access to the job and its details.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutThirdPartyJobSuccessResultRequest.ContinuationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContinuationToken.
A token generated by a job worker, such as an AWS CodeDeploy deployment ID, that a successful job provides to identify a partner action in progress. Future jobs use this token to identify the running instance of the action. It can be reused to return more information about the progress of the partner action. When the action is complete, no continuation token should be supplied.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutThirdPartyJobSuccessResultRequest.CurrentRevision

The details of the actions taken and results produced on an artifact as it passes through stages in the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutThirdPartyJobSuccessResultRequest.JobId
member.summary:

member.summary: This is the response object from the PutThirdPartyJobSuccessResult operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutWebhookRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutWebhook operation. Defines a webhook and returns a unique webhook URL generated by CodePipeline. This URL can be supplied to third party source hosting providers to call every time there's a code change. When CodePipeline receives a POST request on this URL, the pipeline defined in the webhook is started as long as the POST request satisfied the authentication and filtering requirements supplied when defining the webhook. RegisterWebhookWithThirdParty and DeregisterWebhookWithThirdParty APIs can be used to automatically configure supported third parties to call the generated webhook URL.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutWebhookRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tags for the webhook.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutWebhookRequest.Webhook
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Webhook.
The detail provided in an input file to create the webhook, such as the webhook name, the pipeline name, and the action name. Give the webhook a unique name that helps you identify it. You might name the webhook after the pipeline and action it targets so that you can easily recognize what it's used for later.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutWebhookResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutWebhook operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.PutWebhookResponse.Webhook
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Webhook.
The detail returned from creating the webhook, such as the webhook name, webhook URL, and webhook ARN.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.RegisterWebhookWithThirdPartyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the RegisterWebhookWithThirdParty operation. Configures a connection between the webhook that was created and the external tool with events to be detected.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.RegisterWebhookWithThirdPartyRequest.WebhookName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WebhookName.
The name of an existing webhook created with PutWebhook to register with a supported third party.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.RegisterWebhookWithThirdPartyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the RegisterWebhookWithThirdParty operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.RetryStageExecutionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the RetryStageExecution operation. Resumes the pipeline execution by retrying the last failed actions in a stage. You can retry a stage immediately if any of the actions in the stage fail. When you retry, all actions that are still in progress continue working, and failed actions are triggered again.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.RetryStageExecutionRequest.PipelineExecutionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineExecutionId.
The ID of the pipeline execution in the failed stage to be retried. Use the GetPipelineState action to retrieve the current pipelineExecutionId of the failed stage

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.RetryStageExecutionRequest.PipelineName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineName.
The name of the pipeline that contains the failed stage.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.RetryStageExecutionRequest.RetryMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RetryMode.
The scope of the retry attempt. Currently, the only supported value is FAILED_ACTIONS.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.RetryStageExecutionRequest.StageName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StageName.
The name of the failed stage to be retried.

member.summary: Represents the output of a RetryStageExecution action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.RetryStageExecutionResponse.PipelineExecutionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineExecutionId.
The ID of the current workflow execution in the failed stage.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.StopExecutionTrigger
member.summary: The interaction that stopped a pipeline execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.StopExecutionTrigger.Reason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Reason.
The user-specified reason the pipeline was stopped.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.StopPipelineExecutionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StopPipelineExecution operation. Stops the specified pipeline execution. You choose to either stop the pipeline execution by completing in-progress actions without starting subsequent actions, or by abandoning in-progress actions. While completing or abandoning in-progress actions, the pipeline execution is in a Stopping state. After all in-progress actions are completed or abandoned, the pipeline execution is in a Stopped state.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.StopPipelineExecutionRequest.Abandon
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Abandon.
Use this option to stop the pipeline execution by abandoning, rather than finishing, in-progress actions.
This option can lead to failed or out-of-sequence tasks.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.StopPipelineExecutionRequest.PipelineExecutionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineExecutionId.
The ID of the pipeline execution to be stopped in the current stage. Use the GetPipelineState action to retrieve the current pipelineExecutionId.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.StopPipelineExecutionRequest.PipelineName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineName.
The name of the pipeline to stop.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.StopPipelineExecutionRequest.Reason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Reason.
Use this option to enter comments, such as the reason the pipeline was stopped.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.StopPipelineExecutionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StopPipelineExecution operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.StopPipelineExecutionResponse.PipelineExecutionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineExecutionId.
The unique system-generated ID of the pipeline execution that was stopped.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJob
member.summary: A response to a PollForThirdPartyJobs request returned by AWS CodePipeline when there is a job to be worked on by a partner action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJob.ClientId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientId.
The clientToken portion of the clientId and clientToken pair used to verify that the calling entity is allowed access to the job and its details.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJob.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The identifier used to identify the job in AWS CodePipeline.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobData
member.summary: Represents information about the job data for a partner action.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobData.ActionConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionConfiguration.
Represents information about an action configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobData.ActionTypeId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionTypeId.
Represents information about an action type.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobData.ArtifactCredentials
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ArtifactCredentials.
Represents an AWS session credentials object. These credentials are temporary credentials that are issued by AWS Secure Token Service (STS). They can be used to access input and output artifacts in the S3 bucket used to store artifact for the pipeline in AWS CodePipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobData.ContinuationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContinuationToken.
A system-generated token, such as a AWS CodeDeploy deployment ID, that a job requires to continue the job asynchronously.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobData.EncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKey.
The encryption key used to encrypt and decrypt data in the artifact store for the pipeline, such as an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key. This is optional and might not be present.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobData.InputArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputArtifacts.
The name of the artifact that is worked on by the action, if any. This name might be system-generated, such as "MyApp", or it might be defined by the user when the action is created. The input artifact name must match the name of an output artifact generated by an action in an earlier action or stage of the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobData.OutputArtifacts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputArtifacts.
The name of the artifact that is the result of the action, if any. This name might be system-generated, such as "MyBuiltApp", or it might be defined by the user when the action is created.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobData.PipelineContext
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PipelineContext.
Represents information about a pipeline to a job worker.
Does not include pipelineArn and pipelineExecutionId for ThirdParty jobs.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobDetails
member.summary: The details of a job sent in response to a GetThirdPartyJobDetails request.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobDetails.Data
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Data.
The data to be returned by the third party job worker.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobDetails.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The identifier used to identify the job details in AWS CodePipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.ThirdPartyJobDetails.Nonce
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Nonce.
A system-generated random number that AWS CodePipeline uses to ensure that the job is being worked on by only one job worker. Use this number in an AcknowledgeThirdPartyJob request.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookAuthConfiguration
member.summary: The authentication applied to incoming webhook trigger requests.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookAuthConfiguration.AllowedIPRange
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowedIPRange.
The property used to configure acceptance of webhooks in an IP address range. For IP, only the AllowedIPRange property must be set. This property must be set to a valid CIDR range.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookAuthConfiguration.SecretToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretToken.
The property used to configure GitHub authentication. For GITHUB_HMAC, only the SecretToken property must be set.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookDefinition
member.summary: Represents information about a webhook and its definition.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookDefinition.Authentication
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Authentication.
Supported options are GITHUB_HMAC, IP, and UNAUTHENTICATED.
For information about the authentication scheme implemented by GITHUB_HMAC, see Securing your webhooks on the GitHub Developer website.
IP rejects webhooks trigger requests unless they originate from an IP address in the IP range whitelisted in the authentication configuration.
UNAUTHENTICATED accepts all webhook trigger requests regardless of origin.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookDefinition.AuthenticationConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationConfiguration.
Properties that configure the authentication applied to incoming webhook trigger requests. The required properties depend on the authentication type. For GITHUB_HMAC, only the SecretToken property must be set. For IP, only the AllowedIPRange property must be set to a valid CIDR range. For UNAUTHENTICATED, no properties can be set.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookDefinition.Filters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filters.
A list of rules applied to the body/payload sent in the POST request to a webhook URL. All defined rules must pass for the request to be accepted and the pipeline started.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookDefinition.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the webhook.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookDefinition.TargetAction
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetAction.
The name of the action in a pipeline you want to connect to the webhook. The action must be from the source (first) stage of the pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookDefinition.TargetPipeline
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetPipeline.
The name of the pipeline you want to connect to the webhook.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookFilterRule
member.summary: The event criteria that specify when a webhook notification is sent to your URL.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookFilterRule.JsonPath
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JsonPath.
A JsonPath expression that is applied to the body/payload of the webhook. The value selected by the JsonPath expression must match the value specified in the MatchEquals field. Otherwise, the request is ignored. For more information, see Java JsonPath implementation in GitHub.

member.name: P:Amazon.CodePipeline.Model.WebhookFilterRule.MatchEquals
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MatchEquals.
The value selected by the JsonPath expression must match what is supplied in the MatchEquals field. Otherwise, the request is ignored. Properties from the target action configuration can be included as placeholders in this value by surrounding the action configuration key with curly brackets. For example, if the value supplied here is "refs/heads/{Branch}" and the target action has an action configuration property called "Branch" with a value of "master", the MatchEquals value is evaluated as "refs/heads/master". For a list of action configuration properties for built-in action types, see Pipeline Structure Reference Action Requirements.

member.name: T:Amazon.CodePipeline.AmazonCodePipelineClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing CodePipeline
AWS CodePipeline
Overview
This is the AWS CodePipeline API Reference. This guide provides descriptions of the actions and data types for AWS CodePipeline. Some functionality for your pipeline can only be configured through the API. For more information, see the AWS CodePipeline User Guide.
You can use the AWS CodePipeline API to work with pipelines, stages, actions, and transitions.
Pipelines are models of automated release processes. Each pipeline is uniquely named, and consists of stages, actions, and transitions.
You can work with pipelines by calling:
CreatePipeline, which creates a uniquely named pipeline.
DeletePipeline, which deletes the specified pipeline.
GetPipeline, which returns information about the pipeline structure and pipeline metadata, including the pipeline Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
GetPipelineExecution, which returns information about a specific execution of a pipeline.
GetPipelineState, which returns information about the current state of the stages and actions of a pipeline.
ListActionExecutions, which returns action-level details for past executions. The details include full stage and action-level details, including individual action duration, status, any errors that occurred during the execution, and input and output artifact location details.
ListPipelines, which gets a summary of all of the pipelines associated with your account.
ListPipelineExecutions, which gets a summary of the most recent executions for a pipeline.
StartPipelineExecution, which runs the most recent revision of an artifact through the pipeline.
StopPipelineExecution, which stops the specified pipeline execution from continuing through the pipeline.
UpdatePipeline, which updates a pipeline with edits or changes to the structure of the pipeline.
Pipelines include stages. Each stage contains one or more actions that must complete before the next stage begins. A stage results in success or failure. If a stage fails, the pipeline stops at that stage and remains stopped until either a new version of an artifact appears in the source location, or a user takes action to rerun the most recent artifact through the pipeline. You can call GetPipelineState, which displays the status of a pipeline, including the status of stages in the pipeline, or GetPipeline, which returns the entire structure of the pipeline, including the stages of that pipeline. For more information about the structure of stages and actions, see AWS CodePipeline Pipeline Structure Reference.
Pipeline stages include actions that are categorized into categories such as source or build actions performed in a stage of a pipeline. For example, you can use a source action to import artifacts into a pipeline from a source such as Amazon S3. Like stages, you do not work with actions directly in most cases, but you do define and interact with actions when working with pipeline operations such as CreatePipeline and GetPipelineState. Valid action categories are:
Source
Build
Test
Deploy
Approval
Invoke
Pipelines also include transitions, which allow the transition of artifacts from one stage to the next in a pipeline after the actions in one stage complete.
You can work with transitions by calling:
DisableStageTransition, which prevents artifacts from transitioning to the next stage in a pipeline.
EnableStageTransition, which enables transition of artifacts between stages in a pipeline.
Using the API to integrate with AWS CodePipeline
For third-party integrators or developers who want to create their own integrations with AWS CodePipeline, the expected sequence varies from the standard API user. To integrate with AWS CodePipeline, developers need to work with the following items:
Jobs, which are instances of an action. For example, a job for a source action might import a revision of an artifact from a source.
You can work with jobs by calling:
AcknowledgeJob, which confirms whether a job worker has received the specified job.
GetJobDetails, which returns the details of a job.
PollForJobs, which determines whether there are any jobs to act on.
PutJobFailureResult, which provides details of a job failure.
PutJobSuccessResult, which provides details of a job success.
Third party jobs, which are instances of an action created by a partner action and integrated into AWS CodePipeline. Partner actions are created by members of the AWS Partner Network.
You can work with third party jobs by calling:
AcknowledgeThirdPartyJob, which confirms whether a job worker has received the specified job.
GetThirdPartyJobDetails, which requests the details of a job for a partner action.
PollForThirdPartyJobs, which determines whether there are any jobs to act on.
PutThirdPartyJobFailureResult, which provides details of a job failure.
PutThirdPartyJobSuccessResult, which provides details of a job success.

member.name: M:Amazon.CodePipeline.AmazonCodePipelineClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonCodePipelineClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.CodePipeline.AmazonCodePipelineClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonCodePipelineClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.CodePipeline.AmazonCodePipelineClient.#ctor(Amazon.CodePipeline.AmazonCodePipelineConfig)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonCodePipelineClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.

member.param: The AmazonCodePipelineClient Configuration Object
